entry.desc: # of blending rows in the outer integration domain

central latitude
longitude of lower-left
latitude of lower-left
longitude of upper-right
latitude of upper-right
random seeds (if 0 use system clock)
number of weights for stochastic surface perturbation
magnitude of surface albedo perturbation
magnitude of perturbation of leaf area index
magnitude of perturbation of soil hydraulic conductivity
magnitude of perturbation of vegetation fraction
magnitude of perturbation of momentum roughness length
magnitude of perturbation of heat to momentum roughness length ratio
length scales
time scales
forecast hour to write out random pattern in order to restart the pattern for a different forecast (used in DA), file is stoch_out.F
random seeds (if 0 use system clock)
seeds for setting the random number sequence (ignored if stochini is true)
seeds for setting the random number sequence (ignored if stochini is true)
number of latitude point for the Gaussian grid
number of longitude point for the Gaussian grid
spectral resolution (e.g. T126) of random patterns
amplitude of stochastic boundary layer specific humidity perturbations
decorrelation spatial scales in meters
e-folding lengthscale (in units of sigma) of specific humidity perturbations
decorrelation time scales in seconds
stochastic KE backscatter amplitude
decorrelation spatial scales in meters
number of passes of smoother for dissipation estimate
sigma levels to taper perturbations to zeros
sigma levels to taper perturbations to zeros
decorrelation timescales in seconds
gaussian or power law variance spectrum for SKEB (0: gaussian, 1: power law)
the number of degrees of freedom in the vertical for the SKEB random pattern
0: random pattern is stream function,1: pattern is kenorm, 2: pattern is vorticity
amplitude of random patterns
logit transform for SPPT to bounded interval [-1,+1]
decorrelation spatial scales in meters
reduce amplitude of SPPT near surface (lowest 2 levels)
sigma levels to taper perturbations to zeros
sigma levels to taper perturbations to zeros
decorrelation time scales in seconds
set to true if wanting to read in a previous random pattern (input file need to be named stoch_ini)
flag for mountain blocking. .T. = do not apply perturbations below the dividing streamline that is diagnosed by the gravity wave drag, mountain blocking scheme
Target grid mosaic file
Directory containing target grid pre-computed fixed data (ex: soil type)
Directory containing the target grid orography files
Target grid orography files.
Input grid mosaic file. Not used with "gaussian" or "gfs_gaussian" input type.
Directory containing the input grid orography files. Not used for "gaussian" or "gfs_gaussian" input types.
Input grid orography files. Not used for "gaussian" or "gfs_gaussian" input types.
File name of input nst data. Only used for input_type "gfs_gaussian".
File names containing input surface data (for each tile)
File names of input atmospheric data (for each tile)
File names of input atmospheric data (for grib2)

File names of input atmospheric restart tracer files
Directory containing input atm or sfc files
Variable mapping table for Grib2
Vertical coordinate definition file
Cycle month
Cycle day
Cycle hour
Convert atmospheric data when true
Convert nst data when true
Convert sfc data when true
For regional target grids. When '1' remove boundary halo region from atmospheric/surface data and output atmospheric boundary file. When '2' output boundary file only. Default is '0' (global grids).
Input data type: "restart" for fv3 tiled restart files; "history" for fv3 tiled history files; "gaussian" for fv3 gaussian nemsio files; "gfs_gaussian" for spectral gfs gaussian nemsio files.
File containing pre-computed weights to horizontally interpolate atmospheric fields
Name of each atmos tracer to be processed. These names will be used to identify the tracer records in the output files. Follows the convention in the field table.
Name of each atmos tracer record in the input file. May be different from value in 'tracers'.
Number of row/cols of lateral halo, where pure lateral bndy conditions are applied (regional target grids).
Number of row/cols of blending halo, where model tendencies and lateral boundary tendencies are applied. Regional target grids only.

Output file format
